welcome_message_body: "Welcome to Closter, a charming city known for its picturesque views and friendly community. We invite you to explore and discover all that our beautiful city has to offer. Enjoy your stay!"

terminals.name: Main Terminal
terminals.description: The main terminal at Teterboro Airport serves all commercial and private flights.

terminals.name: Private Terminal
terminals.description: The private terminal at Teterboro Airport caters to private and charter flights.

wifi.note: Free WiFi is available throughout the airport.

terminals.name: Terminal A
terminals.description: The oldest terminal at LaGuardia Airport, primarily used by Delta Airlines.

terminals.name: Terminal B
terminals.description: The newest terminal at LaGuardia Airport, primarily used by American Airlines and its partners.

terminals.name: Terminal C
terminals.description: The main terminal at LaGuardia Airport, used by various airlines including United, JetBlue, and Southwest.

terminals.name: Terminal D
terminals.description: The smallest terminal at LaGuardia Airport, used by smaller regional airlines.

wifi.note: WiFi is available throughout the airport, but may be limited in certain areas.

terminals.name: Main Terminal
terminals.description: The main terminal at Westchester County Apt Airport handles all domestic and international flights.

terminals.name: Private Terminal
terminals.description: The private terminal at Westchester County Apt Airport caters to private and corporate aircrafts.

wifi.note: Free WiFi is available throughout the airport.

terminals.name: Main Terminal
terminals.description: The main terminal at Caldwell Wright Airport handles all commercial flights and serves as the primary hub for the airport.

terminals.name: Private Terminal
terminals.description: The private terminal at Caldwell Wright Airport caters to private and charter flights, providing a more exclusive and luxurious experience for passengers.

wifi.note: Passengers can enjoy free WiFi throughout the airport. Network name and password can be obtained at information desks.

terminals.name: Terminal A
terminals.description: This terminal primarily serves domestic flights and is home to several airlines including United and JetBlue.

terminals.name: Terminal B
terminals.description: This terminal serves both domestic and international flights and is home to airlines such as American, Delta, and Spirit.

terminals.name: Terminal C
terminals.description: This terminal is exclusively used by United Airlines for both domestic and international flights.

wifi.note: Passengers can connect to the free WiFi network for up to 4 hours per day.

terminals.name: Terminal 1
terminals.description: Handles international flights for various airlines.

terminals.name: Terminal 2
terminals.description: Serves as the hub for Delta airlines.

terminals.name: Terminal 4
terminals.description: One of the largest terminals, accommodating multiple airlines and international flights.

terminals.name: Terminal 5
terminals.description: Used exclusively by JetBlue airlines.

terminals.name: Terminal 7
terminals.description: Serves as the hub for British Airways and other international airlines.

terminals.name: Terminal 8
terminals.description: Used by American Airlines and other domestic and international carriers.

terminals.name: Terminal 9
terminals.description: Handles domestic flights for various airlines.

wifi.note: Free WiFi is available throughout the airport.

terminals.name: Main Terminal
terminals.description: The main terminal at Linden Airport serves both commercial and private flights.

terminals.name: Private Terminal
terminals.description: The private terminal at Linden Airport caters to executive and private flights.

wifi.note: Free WiFi is available throughout the airport.
